trans-unit.source: Recovering data from another DPM server in the backup vault | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Recovering data from another DPM server in the backup vault | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Recover the data you've protected to an Azure Backup vault from any DPM server registered to that vault.
trans-unit.target: Recover the data you've protected to an Azure Backup vault from any DPM server registered to that vault.

trans-unit.source: Recovering data from another DPM server in the backup vault
trans-unit.target: Recovering data from another DPM server in the backup vault

trans-unit.source: You can now recover the data you've protected to an Azure Backup vault from any DPM server registered to that vault.
trans-unit.target: You can now recover the data you've protected to an Azure Backup vault from any DPM server registered to that vault.

trans-unit.source: The process for doing so is completely integrated into the DPM management console and is similar to the other recovery workflows.
trans-unit.target: The process for doing so is completely integrated into the DPM management console and is similar to the other recovery workflows.

trans-unit.source: To recover data from another DPM server inthe backup vault you'll need [System Center Data Protection Manager UR7](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3065246) and the [latest Azure Backup agent](http://aka.ms/azurebackup_agent).
trans-unit.target: To recover data from another DPM server inthe backup vault you'll need [System Center Data Protection Manager UR7](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3065246) and the [latest Azure Backup agent](http://aka.ms/azurebackup_agent).

trans-unit.source: Recover data from another DPM Server
trans-unit.target: Recover data from another DPM Server

trans-unit.source: To recover data from another DPM server:
trans-unit.target: To recover data from another DPM server:

trans-unit.source: From the **Recovery** tab of the DPM management console, click **'Add External DPM'** (at the top left of the screen).
trans-unit.target: From the **Recovery** tab of the DPM management console, click **'Add External DPM'** (at the top left of the screen).

trans-unit.source: Ad External DPM
trans-unit.target: Ad External DPM

trans-unit.source: Download new **vault credentials** from the vault associated with the **DPM server** where the data is being recovered, choose the DPM server from the list of DPM servers registered with the backup vault, and provide the **encryption passphrase** associated with the DPM server whose data is being recovered.
trans-unit.target: Download new **vault credentials** from the vault associated with the **DPM server** where the data is being recovered, choose the DPM server from the list of DPM servers registered with the backup vault, and provide the **encryption passphrase** associated with the DPM server whose data is being recovered.

trans-unit.source: External DPM Credentials
trans-unit.target: External DPM Credentials

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Only DPM servers associated with the same registration vault can recover each other’s data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Only DPM servers associated with the same registration vault can recover each other’s data.

trans-unit.source: Once the External DPM server is successfully added, you can browse the data of external DPM server and local DPM server from the **Recovery** tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the External DPM server is successfully added, you can browse the data of external DPM server and local DPM server from the **Recovery** tab.

trans-unit.source: Browse the available list of production servers protected by the external DPM server and select the appropriate data source.
trans-unit.target: Browse the available list of production servers protected by the external DPM server and select the appropriate data source.

trans-unit.source: Browse External DPM Server
trans-unit.target: Browse External DPM Server

trans-unit.source: Select **the month and year** from the **Recovery points** drop down, select the required **Recovery date** for when the recovery point was created, and select the **Recovery time**.
trans-unit.target: Select **the month and year** from the **Recovery points** drop down, select the required **Recovery date** for when the recovery point was created, and select the **Recovery time**.

trans-unit.source: A list of files and folders will appear in the bottom pane which can be browsed and recovered to any location.
trans-unit.target: A list of files and folders will appear in the bottom pane which can be browsed and recovered to any location.

trans-unit.source: External DPM Server Recovery Points
trans-unit.target: External DPM Server Recovery Points

trans-unit.source: Right click the appropriate item and click **Recover**.
trans-unit.target: Right click the appropriate item and click **Recover**.

trans-unit.source: External DPM recovery
trans-unit.target: External DPM recovery

trans-unit.source: Review the **Recover Selection**.
trans-unit.target: Review the **Recover Selection**.

trans-unit.source: Verify the data and time of the backup copy being recovered, as well as the source from which the backup copy was created.
trans-unit.target: Verify the data and time of the backup copy being recovered, as well as the source from which the backup copy was created.

trans-unit.source: If the selection is incorrect, click **Cancel** to navigate back to recovery tab to select appropriate recovery point.
trans-unit.target: If the selection is incorrect, click **Cancel** to navigate back to recovery tab to select appropriate recovery point.

trans-unit.source: If the selection is correct, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: If the selection is correct, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: External DPM recovery summary
trans-unit.target: External DPM recovery summary

trans-unit.source: Select **Recover to an alternate location**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Recover to an alternate location**.

trans-unit.source: **Browse** to the correct location for the recovery.
trans-unit.target: **Browse** to the correct location for the recovery.

trans-unit.source: External DPM recovery alternate location
trans-unit.target: External DPM recovery alternate location

trans-unit.source: Choose the option related to **create copy**, **Skip**, or **Overwrite**.
trans-unit.target: Choose the option related to **create copy**, **Skip**, or **Overwrite**.

trans-unit.source: **Create copy** will create a copy of the file in the event there is a name collision.
trans-unit.target: **Create copy** will create a copy of the file in the event there is a name collision.

trans-unit.source: **Skip** will skip recovering the file in the event there is a name collision.
trans-unit.target: **Skip** will skip recovering the file in the event there is a name collision.

trans-unit.source: **Overwrite** will overwrite the existing copying in the location specified in the event of a name collision.
trans-unit.target: **Overwrite** will overwrite the existing copying in the location specified in the event of a name collision.

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate option to **Restore security**.
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate option to **Restore security**.

trans-unit.source: You can apply the security settings of the destination computer where the data is being recovered or the security settings that were applicable to product at the time the recovery point was created.
trans-unit.target: You can apply the security settings of the destination computer where the data is being recovered or the security settings that were applicable to product at the time the recovery point was created.

trans-unit.source: Identify whether a **Notification** will be sent once the recovery completes successfully.
trans-unit.target: Identify whether a **Notification** will be sent once the recovery completes successfully.

trans-unit.source: External DPM Recovery Notifications
trans-unit.target: External DPM Recovery Notifications

trans-unit.source: The **Summary** screen lists the options chosen so far.
trans-unit.target: The **Summary** screen lists the options chosen so far.

trans-unit.source: Once you click **‘Recover’**, the data will be recovered to the appropriate on-premises location.
trans-unit.target: Once you click **‘Recover’**, the data will be recovered to the appropriate on-premises location.

trans-unit.source: External DPM Recovery Options Summary
trans-unit.target: External DPM Recovery Options Summary

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The recovery job can be monitored in the **Monitoring** tab of the DPM server.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The recovery job can be monitored in the **Monitoring** tab of the DPM server.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring Recovery
trans-unit.target: Monitoring Recovery

trans-unit.source: You can click **Clear External DPM** on the **Recovery** tab of the DPM server to remove the view of the external DPM server.
trans-unit.target: You can click **Clear External DPM** on the **Recovery** tab of the DPM server to remove the view of the external DPM server.

trans-unit.source: Clear External DPM
trans-unit.target: Clear External DPM

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting Error Messages
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting Error Messages

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Error Message
trans-unit.target: Error Message

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting steps
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting steps

trans-unit.source: This server is not registered to the vault specified by the vault credential.
trans-unit.target: This server is not registered to the vault specified by the vault credential.

trans-unit.source: **Cause:** This error appears when the vault credential file selected does not belong to the backup vault associated with DPM server on which the recovery is attempted.
trans-unit.target: **Cause:** This error appears when the vault credential file selected does not belong to the backup vault associated with DPM server on which the recovery is attempted.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Download the vault credential file from the backup vault to which the DPM server is registered.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Download the vault credential file from the backup vault to which the DPM server is registered.

trans-unit.source: Either the recoverable data is not available or the selected server is not a DPM server.
trans-unit.target: Either the recoverable data is not available or the selected server is not a DPM server.

trans-unit.source: **Cause:** There are no other DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 registered to the backup vault, or the DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 have not yet uploaded the metadata, or the selected server is not DPM server (aka Windows Server or Windows Client).
trans-unit.target: **Cause:** There are no other DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 registered to the backup vault, or the DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 have not yet uploaded the metadata, or the selected server is not DPM server (aka Windows Server or Windows Client).

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault, ensure SCDPM 2012 R2 UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent are installed.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault, ensure SCDPM 2012 R2 UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent are installed.

trans-unit.source: If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault with DPM 2012 R2 UR7, wait for a day after installation of UR7 to start the recovery process.
trans-unit.target: If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault with DPM 2012 R2 UR7, wait for a day after installation of UR7 to start the recovery process.

trans-unit.source: The nightly job will upload the metadata for all the previously protected backups to cloud.
trans-unit.target: The nightly job will upload the metadata for all the previously protected backups to cloud.

trans-unit.source: The data will be available for recovery.
trans-unit.target: The data will be available for recovery.

trans-unit.source: No other DPM server is registered to this vault.
trans-unit.target: No other DPM server is registered to this vault.

trans-unit.source: **Cause:** There are no other DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 or above that are registered to the vault from which the recovery is being attempted.
trans-unit.target: **Cause:** There are no other DPM servers with DPM 2012 R2 UR7 or above that are registered to the vault from which the recovery is being attempted.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault, ensure SCDPM 2012 R2 UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent are installed.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault, ensure SCDPM 2012 R2 UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent are installed.

trans-unit.source: If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault with DPM 2012 R2 UR7, wait for a day after installation of UR7 to start the recovery process.
trans-unit.target: If there are other DPM servers registered to the backup vault with DPM 2012 R2 UR7, wait for a day after installation of UR7 to start the recovery process.

trans-unit.source: The nightly job will upload the metadata for all the previously protected backups to cloud.
trans-unit.target: The nightly job will upload the metadata for all the previously protected backups to cloud.

trans-unit.source: The data will be available for recovery.
trans-unit.target: The data will be available for recovery.

trans-unit.source: The encryption passphrase provided does not match with passphrase associated with the following server: **<server name>**
trans-unit.target: The encryption passphrase provided does not match with passphrase associated with the following server: **<server name>**

trans-unit.source: **Cause:** The encryption passphrase used in the process of encrypting the data from the DPM server’s data that is being recovered does not match the encryption passphrase provided.
trans-unit.target: **Cause:** The encryption passphrase used in the process of encrypting the data from the DPM server’s data that is being recovered does not match the encryption passphrase provided.

trans-unit.source: The agent is unable to decrypt the data.
trans-unit.target: The agent is unable to decrypt the data.

trans-unit.source: Hence the recovery fails.
trans-unit.target: Hence the recovery fails.

trans-unit.source: **Resolution:** Please provide the exact same encryption passphrase associated with the DPM server whose data is being recovered.
trans-unit.target: **Resolution:** Please provide the exact same encryption passphrase associated with the DPM server whose data is being recovered.

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions:
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions:

trans-unit.source: Why can’t I add an external DPM server from another DPM server after installing the UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent?
trans-unit.target: Why can’t I add an external DPM server from another DPM server after installing the UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent?

trans-unit.source: A) For the existing DPM servers with data sources that are protected to the cloud (by using an update rollup earlier than Update Rollup 7), you have to wait at least one day after installing the UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent to start *Add External DPM server*.
trans-unit.target: A) For the existing DPM servers with data sources that are protected to the cloud (by using an update rollup earlier than Update Rollup 7), you have to wait at least one day after installing the UR7 and latest Azure Backup agent to start *Add External DPM server*.

trans-unit.source: This is needed to upload the metadata of the DPM protection groups to Azure.
trans-unit.target: This is needed to upload the metadata of the DPM protection groups to Azure.

trans-unit.source: This occurs the first time through a nightly job.
trans-unit.target: This occurs the first time through a nightly job.

trans-unit.source: What is the minimum version of Azure Backup agent needed?
trans-unit.target: What is the minimum version of Azure Backup agent needed?

trans-unit.source: A) The Azure Backup agent minimum version to enable this feature is 2.0.8719.0.
trans-unit.target: A) The Azure Backup agent minimum version to enable this feature is 2.0.8719.0.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup agent version can be verified by navigating to Control Panel **>** All Control Panel items **>** Programs and features **>** Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup agent version can be verified by navigating to Control Panel **>** All Control Panel items **>** Programs and features **>** Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent.

trans-unit.source: If the version is less than 2.0.8719.0, download the [latest Azure Backup agent](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=288905) and install.
trans-unit.target: If the version is less than 2.0.8719.0, download the [latest Azure Backup agent](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=288905) and install.

trans-unit.source: Clear External DPM
trans-unit.target: Clear External DPM

trans-unit.target: Next Steps:
